comment: Katy was a relaxed professor. Shes very sweet and always seems so happy. Take her if you can. Shes pretty reasonable too. You have to go or else you drop a letter grade after missing two classes but thats most of the programs classes.

She's really nice! Class is long, lecture heavy, and boring. She's very passionate in what she teaches which is nice. Would take again as shes an easy grader too. She's very understanding with her students and what she expects. I also took her for ECE 2110 back in the day.

Ive had Mrs. Basch twice and I liked and respected her for EDUC 2110, but I really grew to enjoy her class once we got into her specialization. She cares about her students so much and is there to help us with anything from field experience to not feeling well on class days. She also begins class by reading a childrens book to us

Dr. Basch is by far one of the most amazing professors Ive had so far!! Ive taken her twice and will again in fall. Super sweet. Theres work every week but all so beneficial and shes such an easy grader with lots of great feedback!! Cannot sing enough praise! Wont regret it :)

Professor Basch is amazing! She is an easy grader, and you can tell she cares about her students. She is so sweet and understanding. She will help you in any way that she can, and will also move around assignments to help out her students. I would take her for every single class if I could. Do your work and you will receive an A!
She is involved in the learning process, actually cares about making connections with her students, and gives individualized feedback on assignments.

Very easy professor. Do the bare minimum and you will pass. The modules for summer classes for the first month were very spread out and you had a lot of time to do little assignments. At the end thought, you had groups projects due on the same week, as well as fields experience labs but nothing was too hard to do. Very easy grader. Do not buy book.

Mrs. Basch has been one of my favorite professors so far. She is very passionate about education, and it really shows in the classroom. My class met once a week--everything else was online. There are weekly discussion boards, field experience assignments, papers, and a group project. Overall, the class is easy if you put the effort into it.

Loved her at first but at the end of the semester she gave us a group project and she graded us based on how our group mates did. This isnt cool because some people worked tirelessly and ended up with the sameness grade as another person who didnt help and read off the board to present. I emailed her and she doesnt see an issue with this.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Professor Basch is great! It's mostly lectures and she also brought in some cool guest speakers. There's a weekly discussion assignment online, the field experience assignments, a paper, and a group presentation. The instructions are very clear so if you follow the you will do well. She is very organized and great with communicating with the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: easy class and easy grader

The best prof at KSU that I have taken so far. Her assignments are very clear. There are a handful of (easy and short) discussion questions, and projects, but they are all simple and straightforward. She is a very kind lady and wants to see everyone succeed. She makes you WANT to participate in class conversations, no matter how shy you may be.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super nice and really cares about her students. Watch the online discussions because they are not mentioned in class.
I love Mrs. Basch! She is super nice and I felt like I really learned a lot in her class. She is always willing to help and really cares about her job and students.
She is so sweet and open about what teaching is really like. She's great.
She was one of the best professors I have had at KSU. She really cares about you and what she teaches. As long as you do the work correctly you will have an easy time in her class.

I loved Professor Basch, I would take her again in a heart beat. She cares about her students. She even invited her students to thanksgiving dinner that wouldn't be able to go home for thanksgiving. She is one of the reasons I kept my major as education.

Great professor, super nice, will invite ya'll to a holiday dinner. She goes over the syllabus every day, so ya'll can stay up to date and she explains it for you. Make sure you take field experience seriously, she is very serious about professionalism, dressing up, the assignments, and your hours.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Basch was great! She used to be a school teacher herself, so she connects a lot of personal stories to her lectures. This class is an easy "A" as long as you complete all the work. You have to attend class in order for her to give you a rec into the teacher program.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Loved Ms. Basch so much! She used to be an elementary school teacher, so she really understands the materials and gives a really cool insight when teaching it. Super friendly and very understanding. As long as you participate and do the field experience and the few homework assignments, you WILL get an A in this class!
I took mrs. basch last semester & she is amazing . Very loveable and a easy teacher . take her for 2110 , if you fail this course you are just lazy.! TAKE HER !

I don't remember much and I took it not all that long ago. She is fine. Not hard, fairly easy. Nice enough. It was an intro level class though, so I don't know how she would be as a professor for a harder class. Hybrid course.

LOVED having Mrs. Basch! She was an elementary school teacher before she started lecturing, so she gives you great, real life classroom advice and insight. Very easygoing and understanding. If I could take her for every Educ class if it was possible! Syllabus says textbook is required, but there's a free online version so don't waste your money.

She is the absolute best!! I wish I could have her for every single class. She's so helpful and so sweet too. The class is super easy too, and she's a really easy grader. There is a lot of outside work, but it's more the department rather than her giving it out.  She says we use the textbook, but I never got one and was perfectly fine.

She is absolutely amazing. She is so passionate about education and speaks from real life experiences. She is so understanding and does not assign a ton of work, but there are 15 hours of field experience. I wish I could have her teach every single class I take, because I think I would come out of it as a truly better teacher.

One of my favorite professors I've had at KSU. She's awesome and so nice. She is willing to do whatever it takes for her students to be successful teachers. Very understanding, and knowledgeable about the subject and always fully answers your questions. Take her!

I currently have Mrs. Basch for an online class and she's been great! Very clear about assignments and when they are due, easy and interesting material, and responds usually within only a few hours to e-mails. She is definitely willing to help if you need it with no problem. Would take again!

I am taking her online this summer and she is great!!!! The class is based on readings and discussions, but it is all very interesting material. There is one two page paper you have to write, and two field experience lab reports you must do. This is a very informative but easy class!! Professor Basch is so nice and responds quickly to emails!

I love her! I never thought I could teach pre-school and yet, here I am with my own 4 year old classroom. I learned so much from this professor and would take her again in a heartbeat. There's a couple big assignments but she's open about them on day one and prepares you to work on them. (Hint: get started early if possible) Take her!
Great class. Very knowledgable and helpful. We did activities to help wake us up and we could use with students. Turn in work on time and you'll be fine. Love her!

Absolutely would take again. Very clear & helpful. Few assignments & lesson plans but very easy. Group project at end of the semester, easy. She's so caring & loves her class & what she is teaching. Class goes by quickly. Lectures, but just feels like you're having conversation. Field experience required. Love love love her!
She is awesome. Very helpful. Very sweet. Willing to accomadate and not too tough

Nice and helpful. A little hard to figure out and use modules online because of past course data still being used, but she clears up any issues. She is helpful and provides great feedback. She made an optional course very interesting for me. I enjoyed this and her ECE 3313 class

I absolutely loved this class. I learned so much about children's literature and I really think that this class will be beneficial in my teaching career. Professor Basch is a wonderful teacher and is passionate about children's literature. This class is easy to follow and well worth taking. Highly recommend!

I took a Hybrid with Ms. Basch, though hybrid assignments were scarce and were just discussions online. Lots of lesson plans but totally worthwhile & helped me grow as a teacher. Pre-k field experience was AWESOME. A lot less work than other teachers require. She's nice & helpful, though she does lecture more than discuss content.
Such a sweet lady. She is very passionate about what she teaches. If you go to class and do the work you will get an A. EASY A.

She is a GREAT teacher! I will take her again for other classes! She is funny and sweet and wants her students to succeed. She is understanding and will help you if you ask. She does not ask too much of her students and understands when life gets in the way of school!

Had a negative experience w/ my preschool curriculum class. The CT waited till AFTER the midterm eval & on the very last pg wrote a note to email her. After playing phone tag her negative comments boiled down me being too tall for the chairs & them refusing to cooperate with my take home project. I lost a letter grade b/c of this school. Thanks.

Professor Basch is amazing. She is very sweet and wants all of her students to get the grade they deserve. Definitely an easy A, and I did learn a lot from her class. Quizzes are easy if you study and all of the projects are easy, just a bit time consuming.

Very easy class but requires some work.  WONDERFUL PROFESSOR!!  I learned so much about child development by reading a little from the textbooks--you don't have to use the books...but it is very helpful.
Mrs. Basch is a very sweet, caring, and knowledgeable person. I learned a lot from her class, I highly recommend taking her class.

I love Mrs. Basch! She is super sweet, nice, and helpful to her students. She use to teach young children too so she has had a lot of experience. We do 3-4 lesson plans, plus the 35 hours of field observation, along with a final group project at the end. Take her!
Great teacher! However, I didn't feel like I learned a whole lot.
Excellent teacher! Very resourceful. Instructions and expectations are straight-forward and clear. Do your work, come to class, and you're good to go!
By far the best Education teacher at Kennesaw!
Katy is a great teacher. She really wants you to learn. There is a lot of work to do but she will help you in any way she can.

Katy is by far the best teacher I've had at KSU. This is the 1st class I've actually learned anything in. The projects are fun & useful(youll be able to use EVERYTHING in your future classroom) I suggest getting started quickly with the FE and keeping records of everything you do-she expects paperwork for everyday you go. Im taking her for 3330 too
Favorite teacher at Kennesaw by far!

Lots of work but worth it! The midterm is a phonics quiz and the other 2 tests are easy. She is wonderful, fair, easily approachable, and fun! You will learn alot and the projects are fun. Gives 10 extra points for perfect attendance. Take her!
I found it easy to follow this teacher.  She gave projects and tests and I never felt lost.
Katy is an amzign professor with fun projects and assignments! I HIGHLY recommeded taking her class!
